forumNotes.author: Hasleo
forumNotes.content:
![Posted Image](http://reboot.pro/index.php?app=downloads&module=display§ion=screenshot&id=547) **File Name** : WinToUSB **File Submitter** : [easyuefi](http://reboot.pro/user/66238-easyuefi/ "") **File Submitted** : 18 Mar 2015 **File Updated** : *09 Aug 2017* **File Category** : [Boot tools](http://reboot.pro/files/category/7-boot-tools/ "") [WinToUSB](http://www.easyuefi.com/wintousb/index.html "External link") (also called Windows To USB) is the best [Windows To Go](http://www.easyuefi.com/wintousb/faq/en_US/What-is-Windows-To-Go.html "External link") Creator which allows you to install and run fully-functional Windows operating system on an external hard drive or USB flash drive, using an ISO, WIM, ESD, SWM, VHD, VHDX image file or a CD/DVD drive as the source of installation, or you can clone current Windows OS installation (Windows 7 or later) to a USB drive as a Windows To Go Workspace. WinToUSB also supports creating a Windows installation USB flash drive from a Windows 10/8.1/8/7/Vista/2008/2012/2016 installation ISO file, so you can install Windows from the USB flash drive easily. WinToUSB's key features include: * Easy-to-use wizard interface that provides step-by-step instructions for creating a Windows To Go USB drive. * Creation of Windows To Go from an ISO/WIM/ESD/SWM image file or CD/DVD drive. * Clone an existing Windows OS (Windows 7 or later) to a USB Drive as a Windows To Go Workspace. * Use of a Non-Enterprise Edition of Windows 10/8.1/8/7 to create Windows To Go Workspace. * Creation of Windows To Go on Non-Certified Windows To Go USB Drive. * Support for creating VHD-based/VHDX-based Windows To Go Workspace. * Creation of Windows installation USB flash drive with both BIOS and UEFI support
[Click here to download this file](http://reboot.pro/files/file/547-wintousb/ "")

forumNotes.author: alacran
forumNotes.content:
I read very good comments about this free (for non Enterprise users) tool in other forum, haven't tested it but just downloaded to give it a try.

**EDIT:** Version V2.4 Beta (2015.9.17) is in their page

alacran

forumNotes.author: steve6375
forumNotes.content:
I use WinToUSB to prepare multiple Windows Easy2boot images. It is very good.

[http://rmprepusb.blo...to-go-onto.html](http://rmprepusb.blogspot.co.uk/2015/07/quickly-install-windows-78-to-go-onto.html "External link")

If using a *Removable*USB flash drive, choose the VHD option for Win 8.1 and 10 or it won't boot correctly.

forumNotes.author: TheHive
forumNotes.content:
Wanted to say thanks!

Tried the program on a Windows 7 Pro iso to a 16gb sandisk usb stick and it works.

When first booting from usb stick, it started as if a new install of win7. It seem not to want to boot to the desktop after it ran hardware installing. So i shut it off and restarted the pc. This time it booted to desktop. Had to install a couple of missing drivers.

![:good:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/good.gif)

forumNotes.author: Rootman
forumNotes.content:
I too have had very good luck with this util. I periodically use it to clone my home laptop as an emergency backup should my SSD ever bite the dust. It comes across perfectly and will boot and look just like my own laptop.

Very, very useful.
